main event: A civilian observer reported seeing an elongated, silver-colored object flying across the Newburgh-Beacon Bridge in Newburgh, New York on October 18, 1966.
interesting points: The object was compared in size to a short cigar held at arm's length.
The observer had very poor eyesight and had to use a magnifying glass to read small print.
The observer was unable to discern any features or details of the object.
The object was first noticed due to the reflection of the sun.
The object was visible for about 1 minute before suddenly disappearing.
